intro: Tristachya ringoetii, commonly known as the golden beardgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and golden-colored inflorescence. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming dense, brush-like structures that give it its common name. Tristachya ringoetii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
